title: Lionel Messi handed four-game ban by FIFA for swearing at match officials
text:
Lionel Messi has been suspended for four games by FIFA (Picture: Getty) Lionel Messi has been handed a four-game ban by FIFA following an incident which followed Argentina’s win over Chile last week.
Five players in the Mourinho mould who could fit his plans to restore Man Utd to greatness The Barcelona superstar kept his nations’ hopes of qualifying for next summer’s World Cup alive by scoring the only goal in Argentina’s 1-0 over the Copa America holders on Thursday.
Argentina are due to face Bolivia this evening but will do so without their star forward after he was found to have abused a match official following the victory in Buenos Aires.
Messi banned for four games for potty-mouthed outburst, misses Bolivia match tonight. https://t.co/vD1elI1VeL pic.twitter.com/HE0fHL7IPf 
— AS English (@English_AS) March 28, 2017 

Messi has been fined 10,000 Swiss francs and will also miss World Cup qualifiers against Uruguay, Venezuela and Peru before returning for the final match against Ecuador.
A statement from FIFA read: ‘Lionel Messi has been found guilty of violating art. 57 of the FDC for having directed insulting words at an assistant referee.
‘As a result, Messi will be suspended for four official matches and sanctioned with a fine of CHF 10,000. The first match for which the sanction will apply is the next fixture in the preliminary competition of the 2018 FIFA World Cup Russia™ between Bolivia and Argentina, which will be played today, 28 March. The remainder of the sanction will be served over Argentina’s subsequent FIFA World Cup qualifying matches.

‘Both the player and the Argentinian Football Association have been informed of the decision today.’
